title: Lead Group Product Manager, Pixel Intelligent Retention
description: At Google, we put our users first. The world is always changing, so we need Product Managers who are continuously adapting and excited to work on products that affect millions of people every day.
key_qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 10 years of experience in product management or related technical role. 5 years of experience taking technical products from conception to launch. 5 years of experience in people management, with technical leadership. Experience developing consumer hardware or consumer software products.
preferred_qualifications: Experience with driving product vision, marketing, and go-to-market strategy. Deep understanding of phone ecosystems, user behavior, and growth tactics. Familiarity with computing, mobile operating systems, and software application development lifecycles. Ability to think strategically and execute methodically – across a rich set of areas that span different domains. Excellent user experience intuition; demonstrated success in inventing innovative and user-friendly products. Successful track record leading growth-focused initiatives, across user acquisition and retention.
responsibilities: Define the multi-year vision and strategy for core investment areas, manage roadmap and priorities, and oversee high quality on-time execution. Collaborate with cross-functional teams within Pixel (Hardware, Software, Marketing, Research, and more), as well as Android and first-party teams to drive Pixel-specific differentiation and innovation along its key value pillars. Manage and grow product managers on the team through mentorship, guidance, and role modeling.
